intro: Ptilotrichum peyrouseanum, commonly known as Peyrouse's ptilotrichum, is a small, herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as cliffs and slopes. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
